sen.j: 東映太秦映画村（とうえいうずまさえいがむら）は、京都市右京区太秦東蜂ケ岡町にある映画のテーマパーク。
sen.e: Toei Movie Land is a movie theme park locatied in Uzumasa Higashi Hachigaoka Cho, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Toei Movie Land is a movie theme park locatied in Uzumasa Higashi Hachigaoka Cho, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Toei Movie Land is a movie theme park located in Uzumasa Higashi Hachigaoka-cho, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: Hachigaoka-cho としました。スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 東映の京都撮影所を一般公開したもの。
sen.e: Part of Toei Movie Studios of Toei Company, Ltd. is named Toei Movie Land to be open to the public.
Part of Toei Movie Studios owned by Toei Company is named Toei Movie Land and is open to the public.
Part of Toei Movie Studios owned by Toei Company is named Toei Movie Land and is open to the public.

sen.j: 東映は1960年代後半から映画の斜陽化が顕著になると、ヤクザもの映画で観客動員を保つ一方で、時代劇が斜陽になったことからに京都撮影所のオープンセットの維持を画して、その一部を新設子会社の「（株）東映京都スタジオ」に移管し、東映太秦映画村として1975年11月1日に開村・公開した。
sen.e: In the late 1960s, when the downturn of the movie industry was obvious and samurai movies already lost popularity, Toei, with its yakuza movies (Japanese gang movies) bearyl drawing fans, in an attempt to preserve its outdoor sets of the movie studio in Kyoto, transferred part of it to the newly established affiliate company 'Toei Kyoto Studio Co,Ltd.,' which called itself Toei Movie Land to open to the public on November 1, 1975.
sen.cmt: 時代劇とサムライ映画はかならずしも同一とは言えませんが，ここの文の意図には影響せず，samurai movieの方が分かりやすいと思われます．
sen.e: In the late 1960s, when the downturn of the movie industry was obvious and samurai movies were already losing popularity, Toei, with its yakuza movies (Japanese gang movies) bearly drawing fans, attempted to preserve its outdoor studio sets in Kyoto by transferring part of them to the newly established affiliate company 'Toei Kyoto Studio Co,Ltd.,' which called itself Toei Movie Land and opened to the public on November 1, 1975.
sen.cmt: 「already lost」→「were already losing」, 「bearyl」→「bearly」,「in an attempt」→「attempted」, 「sets of the movie studio」→「studio sets」,「, transferred」→「by transferring」, 「it」→「them」,「to open」→「and opened」
sen.e: In the late 1960s, when the downturn of the movie industry was obvious and samurai movies were already losing popularity, Toei, with its yakuza movies (Japanese gang movies) barely drawing fans, attempted to preserve its outdoor studio sets in Kyoto by transferring part of them to the newly established affiliate company 'Toei Kyoto Studio Co., Ltd.,' which called itself Toei Movie Land and opened to the public on November 1, 1975.
sen.cmt: Co., Ltd. としました。スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 時代劇の殺陣ショーや俳優のトークショー・撮影会・握手会などのほか、スーパー戦隊シリーズや仮面ライダー等のキャラクターショー、殺陣講座などの体験企画なども行なわれている。
sen.e: Its attractions are: swordfight stunt shows; actors' talk shows, and photo and hand-shake sessions; TV superhero drama shows such as "Super Sentai" (series of superhero-transformation drama of masked five-member group heroes) or "Kamen Rider" (series of superhero-transformation drama of a masked motorbike rider); and experience of swordfight simulation.

Its attractions are: swordfight stunt shows; actors' talk shows, and photo and hand-shake opportunities; TV superhero drama shows such as "Super Sentai" (a superhero-transformation drama series with five masked heroes) or "Kamen Rider" (a superhero-transformation drama series with a masked motorbike rider); and swordfight simulations.
sen.cmt: 「sessions」→「opportunities」, 「series」箇所異動x2,「five」箇所異動,「experience of」削除, 「s」挿入
sen.e: Its attractions are: swordfight stunt shows; actors' talk shows, and photo and hand-shake opportunities; TV superhero drama shows such as "Super Sentai" (a superhero-transformation drama series with five masked heroes) or "Kamen Rider" (a superhero-transformation drama series with a masked motorbike rider); and swordfight simulations.

sen.j: 舞妓、姫、殿様、武士、町人、町娘、等、時代劇の登場人物への変身体験が出来る変身スタジオもある（予約制）。
sen.e: There is a dress-up studio (reservation is needed) where visitors can experience being costumed in kimono-clad characters of samurai dramas, such as maiko (a teenaged geisha apprentice in Kyoto), hime (a princess living in a castle), tonosama (a lord of samurai), samurai, a merchant, and a teenaged girl of merchant class.

There is a dress-up studio (reservations are needed) where visitors can experience wearing the costumes of characters appearing in samurai dramas, such as maiko (teenaged geisha apprentices in Kyoto), hime (a princess living in a castle), tonosama (samurai lord), samurai, merchant, and a teenaged girl of the merchant class.
sen.cmt: Singular changed to plural form.「being costumed in kimono-clad characters」→「wearing the costumes」, 「of」→「appearing in」,「a」削除, 「the」挿入
sen.e: There is a dress-up studio (reservations are needed) where visitors can experience wearing the costumes of characters appearing in samurai dramas, such as maiko (teenaged geisha apprentices in Kyoto), hime (a princess living in a castle), tonosama (samurai lord), samurai, merchant, and a teenaged girl of the merchant class.

sen.j: 東映系列が運営していることから、東映や系列会社の東映アニメーションが製作した作品（『おジャ魔女どれみ』など）に京都の観光名所としてしばしば登場する。
sen.e: Since this park is affiliated to Toei, scenes of this site often appear on films such as "Ojamajo Doremi" (wicked Do-re-mi), which was produced by Toei Animation, an affiliate of Toei.
Since this park is affiliated to Toei, scenes from this site often appear in films such as "Ojamajo Doremi" (wicked Do-re-mi), which was produced by Toei Animation, an affiliate of Toei.
Since this park is affiliated to Toei, scenes from this site often appear in films such as "Ojamajo Doremi" (wicked Do-re-mi), which was produced by Toei Animation, an affiliate of Toei.

sen.j: また、映画村を舞台にしたオリジナルの特撮の撮影も行われており、いくつかは市場で販売されている。
sen.e: Some movies were filmed at this site using special effects, and some of them are on the market.
Some movies were filmed at this site using special effects, including some currently on sale.
sen.cmt: 再構成しました。'on the market' is perhaps a little colloquial.
sen.e: Some movies were filmed at this site using special effects, including some currently on sale.

sen.j: 隣接する京都撮影所は東映本体の部署であり、子会社の映画村とは業務が連携しているものの東映内部では別物として取り扱われている。
sen.e: Neighboring Toei Movie Studios, the parent company of this park, is Toei's main body whose business they think is different from the park, while part of their work is tied up.
Neighboring Toei Movie Studios, the parent company of this park, is Toei's main body whose business is considered different from the park, even though part of their work is connected.
Neighboring Toei Movie Studios, the parent company of this park, is Toei's main body whose business is considered different from the park, even though part of their work is connected.

sen.e: Get off at 'Uzumasa Eigamura Mae' bus stop, and it is very close to the bus stop.
Get off at 'Uzumasa Eigamura Mae' bus stop, from which it is very close.
Get off at 'Uzumasa Eigamura Mae' bus stop, from which it is very close.

sen.j: 「太秦映画村道」バス停下車徒歩数分
sen.e: Get off at 'Uzumasa Eigamura Michi' bus stop, and it is a few minutes on foot.
Get off at 'Uzumasa Eigamura Michi' bus stop, and it is a few minutes on foot.
Get off at 'Uzumasa Eigamura Michi' bus stop, and it is a few minutes on foot.

sen.e: From 'Uzumasa Koryuji Station', it is five minutes on foot.
From 'Uzumasa Koryuji Station', it is five minutes on foot.
From 'Uzumasa Koryuji Station,' it is five minutes on foot.
sen.cmt: カンマの場所を移動しました。

sen.e: From 'Hanazaono Station' or 'Uzumasa Station,' 13 minutes on foot.
From 'Hanazono Station' or 'Uzumasa Station,' 13 minutes on foot.
From 'Hanazono Station' or 'Uzumasa Station,' thirteen minutes on foot.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: マスコットキャラクター
sen.e: Mascot characters
Mascot characters
Mascot characters

sen.j: かちん太
sen.e: Kachinta
Kachinta
Kachinta

sen.j: 映画村誕生5周年を記念して誕生。
sen.e: This mascot was created in commemoration of the fifth anniversary of Toei Movie Land.
This mascot was created in commemoration of the fifth anniversary of Toei Movie Land.
This mascot was created in commemoration of the fifth anniversary of Toei Movie Land.

sen.j: 股旅姿をしたカラスで、名前はカチンコから取られている。
sen.e: It is a "matatabi" crow (kimono-clad wanderer cartoon crow), and its name comes from "kachinko" (clapperboard).
It is a "matatabi" crow (kimono-clad wanderer cartoon crow), and its name comes from the "kachinko" (clapperboard).
It is a "matatabi" crow (kimono-clad wanderer cartoon crow), and its name comes from the "kachinko" (clapperboard).

sen.j: 園内のシンボルマークや案内板などにデザインされており、かちん太一座によるショーも行われている。
sen.e: You can see it on the park's logo posters or information signs in the park, and also can enjoy shows by the drama group "Kachinta Company."
You can see it on park posters or information signs, and also can enjoy shows by the drama group "Kachinta Company."
sen.cmt: 「the park's logo posters」→「park posters」, 「in the park」削除
sen.e: You can see it on park posters or information signs, and also can enjoy shows by the drama group "Kachinta Company."

sen.j: 2002年に旅に出てマスコットとしては休業していたが、2007年に帰郷、今後マスコットとして本格復帰が検討されている。
sen.e: He had been on a break of his mascot work since 2002 when he "went away on a journey", but he returned from a recess in 2007, and his full operation is being planned.
Kachinta "went on a journey" in 2002 and stopped being a mascot, but he returned home in 2007 and his complete comeback is being planned.
Kachinta "went on a journey" in 2002 and stopped being a mascot, but he returned home in 2007 and his complete comeback is being planned.

sen.j: からす天狗うじゅ
sen.e: Karasu Tengu Uju (literally, crow tengu Uzumasa)
Karasu Tengu Uju (literally, crow tengu Uzumasa)
Karasu Tengu Uju (literally, crow tengu Uzumasa)

sen.j: 映画村で開催のイベント「太秦戦国祭り」の公式キャラクター。
sen.e: It is an official character for 'Uzumasa Sengoku Matsuri' which is an event featuring the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States in 16th century) held at this park.
It is an official character for 'Uzumasa Sengoku Matsuri' which is an event depicting the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States in 16th century) held at this park.
It is an official character for 'Uzumasa Sengoku Matsuri' which is an event depicting the Sengoku period (period of warring states) held at this park.
sen.cmt: period 小文字にしました。

sen.j: かちん太の妹で、鞍馬山で暮らす烏天狗。
sen.e: It is Kachinta's little sister and Karasu Tengu (a mythical mountain creature having supernatural power) who lives in Kurama-yama Mountain.
It is Kachinta's little sister, and Karasu Tengu (a mythical mountain creature having supernatural power) lives in Kurama-yama Mountain.
It is Kachinta's little sister, and Karasu Tengu (a mythical mountain creature having supernatural power) who lives in Mt. Kurama.
sen.cmt: who を追加しました。Mt. Kurama としました。

sen.j: かちん太の行方がわからなくなったため京の町に下りてきた。
sen.e: She has come down to Kyoto to look for Kachinta who was nowhere around.
She came to Kyoto to look for Kachinta when he disappeared.
She came to Kyoto to look for Kachinta when he disappeared.

sen.j: かちん太と違い現代的な萌えキャラなデザインとなっており、イメージソングをMOSAIC.WAVが担当するなど、かちん太とは別の形でキャラクター展開を進めている。
sen.e: In contrast to Kachinta, she was designed to look moe-kyara (referring to a strong interest in particular types of girl character in video games or manga), and MOSAIC.WAV (a Japanese pop band from Akihabara) sings her theme song, to promote her in a different way from Kachinta's.

In contrast to Kachinta, she was designed to look like a moe-kyara (a particular type of girl character in video games or manga), and MOSAIC.WAV (a Japanese pop band from Akihabara) sings her theme song, to promote her in a different way from Kachinta.
sen.cmt: 「like a」挿入, 「referring to a strong interest in」削除, 「a」挿入, 「s」削除, 「Kachinta's」→「Kachinta」
sen.e: In contrast to Kachinta, she was designed to look like a moe-kyara (a particular type of girl character in video games or manga), and MOSAIC.WAV (a Japanese pop band from Akihabara) sings her theme song, to promote her in a different way from Kachinta.
